Know the health quality of your coffee plants to take preventive measures
Early detection of coffee health can help improve the quality of coffee yields

string-array.name: data_judul
string-array.item: Recognize Coffee Plant Pests and Their Control
Coffee Prices Strengthen, Tabanan Farmers Are Happy
Coffee plantation area in Rejang Lebong reaches 30,386.5 hectares
Coffee Farmers Need to Beware of These Climate Threats to Stay in the Game
Types of Coffee in Indonesia that are successful worldwide, what are they?
Improvement of Coffee Plant Pest Management Capability
North Sumatra\'s Coffee Production Worsens, Threatened by El Nino, Pests and European Embargo

string-array.name: data_sub
string-array.item: Coffee Pests and Diseases - One of the leading plantation commodities that is widely cultivated by farmers is coffee.
A number of robusta coffee farmers in Tabanan Regency are happy. How not, the price of one of the plantation products with domestic to export market share is strengthening.

The Department of Agriculture and Fisheries (Distankan) of Rejang Lebong Regency, Bengkulu Province, said that the area of smallholder coffee plantations in the area reached 30,386.5 hectares with annual coffee bean production reaching 16,771.5 tons.
The Meteorology, Climatology and Geophysics Agency (BMKG) predicts the El Nino phenomenon will occur in Indonesia in the second semester of 2023 and may last until early 2024.
The coffee drinking lifestyle continues to grow in Indonesia. Not only does Indonesia have a culture of drinking coffee, but it is also a country that produces delicious coffee

Coffee is an Indonesian plantation commodity with the highest export opportunities. Coffee is an annual crop that can reach a productive age of up to 20 years. Coffee is the most widely traded plantation crop commodity,

The phenomenon of rising temperatures or El Nino is a real threat to coffee production in North Sumatra. In addition to being faced with pest problems, the coffee industry is also facing a European market embargo due to the enactment of the European Union\'s Anti-Deforestation Law.

resources.string: Leaf Miner is a disease that attacks coffee leaves caused by the attack of Leucoptera Caffeine or commonly called leaf miner pests. This pest often appears in lush plantation areas and eats the palisade parenchyma tissue on the leaves which causes

Infected leaves will show round, reddish-brown or dark-brown, well-demarcated patches. In older spots there is a gray-white center, which often appears to be dusted with black powder consisting of fungal conidium. Within the spot there are concentric circles with rings). If the attack is severe enough, it can cause leaf drop.

Currently your plants are in good condition. Continue to improve the quality of your plants by taking some precautions against other diseases and some medicines that can be used to maintain coffee health

Symptoms of phoma leaf blight infection are only seen on older leaves. Affected leaves show irregular, angular, yellow to brown lesions scattered across the lamina. As the disease progresses, the lesions grow and form larger patches that later turn into dull necrotic areas with gray centers and dark edges. In the final stage, the leaves begin to wilt and leaf drop occurs. Alternative host plants include common vines (Vitis vinifera) and Kentucky grass (Poa pratensis)
Leaf rust disease mainly affects arabica coffee grown in the lowlands. Initially, light yellow spots are seen on the leaves. Later, the spots turn dark yellow and are covered with spore powder
Do regular monitoring using Delta traps.
Reduce humidity, adjust lighting, prune diseased leaves, use copper fungicide or mankozeb.
Always clean the area around the plant, fertilize properly, and check soil moisture as it can affect coffee growth
Clean the plant environment regularly to avoid mold growth
Pay attention to fertilization, proper irrigation, and do not plant too tightly
Using neurotoxic insecticides, such as organophosphates, carbamates, pyrethroids, neonicotinoids, and diamides.
Providing organic fertilizer, disease control, and the use of coffee balu containing the flavonoid quercetin.
Spraying with copper-active fungicides (Copper sandoz, Cupravit etc.) or with Mankozeb-active fungicides (Dithane M 45, manzate MX 200)
Cupravit OB 21 0.4%, Bayleton 250 EC 0.1%, Anvil 50 SC 0.2%, Tilt 250 ES 0.1%, Sumiate 2.5 WP 0.2%
